I have a JUnit (3.8.1) test (in eclipse 3.1) that attemps to access a
class=
 for of statics:

public final class SpecifiersHelpers {
	public static fin=
al String DISPLAY_NAME =3D "A nice name";
        public static final Error=
State ERROR_STATE =3D new
ErrorState("foo", null);
....
}

As long as I onl=
y attempt to access primitive types I'm ok. But as
soon as I attempt to acc=
ess ERROR_STATE or any other object from
SpecifiersHelpers, I get an NoClas=
sDefError. From a little googling I
can tell that this is a class loading p=
roblem - but beyond that I
don't understand. The obvious workaround is just=
 to avoid the use of
statics in this situation. However, I want to understa=
nd what's going
on and how I can safely use statics. BTW I'm using statics =
here to
create a number of commonly defined elements.

Any suggestions?
